text: We must look at climate change as if it were a devastating military attack against the United States and the entire planet. And we must respond accordingly.
We must end the absurdity of the United States having more people in jail than any other country on Earth. We must invest in jobs and education for our young people, not more jails and incarceration.

A $5,751 bill for getting an ice pack at a hospital. A $236 pregnancy test. $60 for ibuprofen at the local children’s hospital. 

Too many Americans have to resort to crowd-funding to pay for their outrageous medical bills. Our health care system must change. #MedicareforAll https://twitter.com/voxdotcom/status/1079818240266854402 QT @voxdotcom Jessica Pell went to an emergency room after she fell and cut her ear. She was given an ice pack but no other treatment. Then she got a bill for $5,751. 

This is all due to the key fee @sarahkliff has been investigating this year: the ER facility fee. https://www.vox.com/health-care/2018/12/18/18134825/emergency-room-bills-health-care-costs-america?utm_campaign=vox.social&utm_content=1545937538&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter

Engaging in the fight for civil rights and social justice is not for the faint of heart. It is as difficult as it is important, and the wins may never taste as sweet as the losses taste sour. But count yourself as part of the lineage of those who refused to relent.

As Frederick Douglass reminded us: "If there is no struggle, there is no progress." Real change will not come unless we take on the greed of Wall Street, the drug companies, the fossil fuel industry, the NRA, the military-industrial-complex and other special interests.

When we talk about justice, we have to understand that there is no justice when the top 0.1 percent -- not 1 percent, the top 0.1 percent -- today in America owns almost as much wealth as the bottom 90 percent.

“How much more harmful are the consequences of anger and grief than the circumstances that aroused them in us!”

Marcus Aurelius
